casebody.data:
CITY BANK FARMERS TRUST COMPANY, a Corporation, as Trustee of a Trust under Agreement of William Waldorf Astor Dated May 2, 1911, for the Benefit of Waldorf Astor, and known as the “Real Property Trust”, Plaintiff-Appellee, v. Jane M. HOEY, as Executrix of the Estate of James J. Hoey, Deceased, Defendant-Appellant. No. 62. Circuit Court of Appeals, Second Circuit. Nov. 8, 1943. Howard F. Corcoran, U. S. Atty., of New York City (Marvin M. Notkins, Asst. U. S. Atty., of New York City, of counsel), for appellant. Mitchell, Taylor, Capron & Marsh, of New York City (Charles Angulo, John J. Smith, and Carter T. Louthan, all of New York City, of counsel), for appellee.

Before SWAN, AUGUSTUS N. HAND, and FRANK, Circuit Judges.

PER CURIAM.

Judgment affirmed on the opinion below, 52 F.Supp. 665.
